metadata.Title: CVE-2022-26386 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Previously Firefox for macOS and Linux would download temporary files to a user-specific directory in /tmp, but this behavior was changed to download them to /tmp where they could be affected by other local users. This behavior was reverted to the original, user-specific directory.
*This bug only affects Firefox for macOS and Linux. Other operating systems are unaffected.*. This vulnerability affects Firefox ESR < 91.7 and Thunderbird < 91.7. Update Instructions: Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-26386` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions: thunderbird - 1:91.7.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1 thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:91.7.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1 thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:91.7.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1 xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:91.7.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1 xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:91.7.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1 xul-ext-lightning - 1:91.7.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1 No subscription required

criterions.comment: thunderbird package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:91.7.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1').
